content.description: Consider the following description of the MagicNumber class which includes one constructor and two methods.
content.question: public MagicNumber()– Constructs a MagicNumber object that represents a number public void displayNumber()– Displays the number to the screen public void add_2()– Increases the number by 2 When located in a method in a class other than MagicNumber, which of the following code segments will compile without error? MagicNumber.add_2();MagicNumber.displayNumber(); MagicNumber n1 = new MagicNumber();n1.add_2();n1.displayNumber(); n2.add_2();n2.displayNumber();

choices.label: None of the code segments will compile.

skill.text: 2.C: Write program code involving procedural abstractions.
